message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.DB. 

The paper discusses a method for improving text search using ontological features of named entities and WordNet words, which are commonly used in information retrieval (IR) and natural language processing (NLP) fields. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also mentions the use of spreading activation, which is a technique commonly used in machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) fields. Therefore, cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) are also likely sub-categories. The paper also involves the use of ontologies, which are commonly used in database (DB) and knowledge representation fields. Therefore, cs.DB (Databases) is also a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of machine learning techniques, which are commonly used in the field of machine learning (LG).
